body:
The amount of people in their early and mid twenties who use tiktok and act like edgy emotional 16 year olds is seriously depressing. Whats worse is that this behavior is most concentrated in academia and others supposed places of "enlightenment" because modern academia attracts lots of emotionally stunted people afraid of "adulting" without a nanny system to insulate them. 

When I was surrounded by social media and internet game obsessive people, I always coped by telling myself I’d find more mature and well-rounded people in college/gradschool/career, but it seems like the window for acting like an adult child is stretching wider and wider. No matter how much I advance, I am surrounded by social degeneracy. It’s tiresome.
body_html:
The amount of people in their early and mid twenties who use tiktok and act like edgy emotional 16 year olds is seriously depressing. Whats worse is that this behavior is most concentrated in academia and others supposed places of "enlightenment" because modern academia attracts lots of emotionally stunted people afraid of "adulting" without a nanny system to insulate them.

When I was surrounded by social media and internet game obsessive people, I always coped by telling myself I’d find more mature and well-rounded people in college/gradschool/career, but it seems like the window for acting like an adult child is stretching wider and wider. No matter how much I advance, I am surrounded by social degeneracy. It’s tiresome.
title: I’m honestly saddened by how immature the average adult has become. It feels like I’ll never find a fulfilling relationship because of it.

body:
Feel you. I was 29 when I met my boyfriend who is 49. He looks really young for his age and people are always in disbelief. Im glad he has finally settled with me for the most part (he is 54 i will be 34). What really attracted me to him? He had a flip phone when I met him lol!!! 
Something about a person who had to use a landline for most of their life just makes them different in a good way.

Im glad he has finally settled with me for the most part (he is 54 i will be 34). What really attracted me to him? He had a flip phone when I met him lol!!! Something about a person who had to use a landline for most of their life just makes them different in a good way.

body:
It's been the same for every generation dude, just replace the current mainstream whatever with the old mainstream whatever, it's just amplified nowadays with the internet and media generation.

The trick is not to care about what others do and not compare yourself to others, just do you. In the process of doing your own thing you'll find what you're looking for. If you focus on shit you don't like or the people, the culture etc you find shallow, you're.. well, focusing on it. For what? Focus on something else, yourself, your circle, the stuff you don't find shallow.
body_html:
It's been the same for every generation dude, just replace the current mainstream whatever with the old mainstream whatever, it's just amplified nowadays with the internet and media generation.

If you focus on shit you don't like or the people, the culture etc you find shallow, you're.. well, focusing on it. For what? Focus on something else, yourself, your circle, the stuff you don't find shallow.

body: Well, no, but actually yes. The purpose of every biological being, including you and me and every other human out there, is reproduction. While it is possible to achieve that without a relationship, it is suboptimal.

post.body:
The amount of people in their early and mid twenties who use tiktok and act like edgy emotional 16 year olds is seriously depressing. Whats worse is that this behavior is most concentrated in academia and others supposed places of "enlightenment" because modern academia attracts lots of emotionally stunted people afraid of "adulting" without a nanny system to insulate them. 

When I was surrounded by social media and internet game obsessive people, I always coped by telling myself I’d find more mature and well-rounded people in college/gradschool/career, but it seems like the window for acting like an adult child is stretching wider and wider. No matter how much I advance, I am surrounded by social degeneracy. It’s tiresome.
post.body_html:

When I was surrounded by social media and internet game obsessive people, I always coped by telling myself I’d find more mature and well-rounded people in college/gradschool/career, but it seems like the window for acting like an adult child is stretching wider and wider. No matter how much I advance, I am surrounded by social degeneracy. It’s tiresome.
post.title: I’m honestly saddened by how immature the average adult has become. It feels like I’ll never find a fulfilling relationship because of it.

body: Unfortunately only men have to suffer this. Women have more functions than reproduction, although it is still their main one, they can do others well and be happy. But the SOLE function of the male is reproduction, every fiber of his mind and body is dedicated towards getting sex and serving the female. It sucks (no pun intended :) ).

body: I'm 41. Father of 3, husband of 21 years. We have a very simple rule in our house (one of the only actual rules...) No Drama. If people are toxic or stringing us along, causing upset because of inability to think rationally, we cut them off for a short bit. If it continues, they're out permanently. As a consequence we have a nice short list of friends for life and a relaxed peaceful atmosphere. Our good friends come and go; it's like a little train station. One thing I've noticed as an unintended side effect is that we don't participate in social media.
body_html: I'm 41. Father of 3, husband of 21 years. We have a very simple rule in our house (one of the only actual rules...) No Drama. If people are toxic or stringing us along, causing upset because of inability to think rationally, we cut them off for a short bit. If it continues, they're out permanently. As a consequence we have a nice short list of friends for life and a relaxed peaceful atmosphere. Our good friends come and go; it's like a little train station. One thing I've noticed as an unintended side effect is that we don't participate in social media.

The amount of people in their early and mid twenties who use tiktok and act like edgy emotional 16 year olds is seriously depressing. Whats worse is that this behavior is most concentrated in academia and others supposed places of "enlightenment" because modern academia attracts lots of emotionally stunted people afraid of "adulting" without a nanny system to insulate them.

When I was surrounded by social media and internet game obsessive people, I always coped by telling myself I’d find more mature and well-rounded people in college/gradschool/career, but it seems like the window for acting like an adult child is stretching wider and wider. No matter how much I advance, I am surrounded by social degeneracy. It’s tiresome.
post.title: I’m honestly saddened by how immature the average adult has become. It feels like I’ll never find a fulfilling relationship because of it.
